messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Homeschooling an only child: MULTIPLE SEND  APOLOGIES
messages.msgSnippet: ** Does anybody know of book that would exist to cover the above topic? I have been asked to track down such a book that would cover the unique situations that
messages.messageBody:
** Does anybody know of book that would exist to cover the above topic?
I have
been asked to track down such a book that would cover the unique situations
that exist for such families. I'm sure there are homeschooling books around
that have chapters on this (if there are, I would be interested in knowing
about these, too) but in searching Amazon.com I have been unable to find a
complete book on this subject. If you can help, please email me privately
at blondie@...**


I don't think there is one.

The HEM (Home Education Magazine) message boards used to have a folder
devoted to this topic. It's probably still there.

Betsy

messages.subject: Homeschooling an only child: MULTIPLE SEND APOLOGIES
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all Does anybody know of book that would exist to cover the above topic?  I have been asked to track down such a book that would cover the unique situations
messages.messageBody:
Hi all

Does anybody know of book that would exist to cover the above topic? I have
been asked to track down such a book that would cover the unique situations
that exist for such families. I'm sure there are homeschooling books around
that have chapters on this (if there are, I would be interested in knowing
about these, too) but in searching Amazon.com I have been unable to find a
complete book on this subject. If you can help, please email me privately
at blondie@...

Cheers
Mandy Tyler Edmonds
